q: A Matter of Life and Death," Barbara Walters ' prime-time special airing tomorrow at 10 p.m. on ABC( Ch. 7). "It was very surprising," Barbara Walters says of David Letterman 's response. I'm very fond of David Letterman and he is of me, but he's enormously private... to have him talk as openly as he did with me about his emotions, and what he went through... I was amazed and very happy. "Nor did he ever call me up[ afterward] and say, "Leave this out, leave that out." Barbara Walters also interviews Bill Clinton , Robin Williams , Regis Philbin and Charlie Rose -- all of whom, like Barbara Walters herself, underwent open-heart surgery. Barbara Walters , 81, had a faulty heart valve replaced last May.

interview, Simon Cowell talked about The X Factor launch in America. With auditions set to begin on March 27th in Los Angeles, people can register online now by going to Fox.com/ thexfactor. We actually do the auditions in arenas where you have to perform in front of 4,000-5,000 people. It's a long day. You'll begin to understand why I become very grumpy, Simon Cowell told Nancy O'Dell during the ET interview that aired tonight on ABC. The X Factor auditions are open to vocal groups and solo singers, over the age of 12- and there's no upper age limit.

To witness this unbelievable show of strength and determination was an unbelievable blessing. And it was just a time that we couldn't believe we were there to see her, just show her strength like that. And it was a real testament to who she is. You know, I believe in Gabrielle Giffords .
